intro: Verbascum transolympicum, commonly known as the Trans-Olympic mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating respiratory ailments. Its fibrous leaves and stems have also been utilized in traditional crafts and textiles.
